title: Jim Hall and Bill Frisell - Hemispheres (2008)
description: ArtistShare: AS0079 http://www.artistshare.com/v4/Projects/Experience/7/146 http://www.artistshare.com/v4/Projects/OfferDetails/7/146/1593/1/6 http://www.jimhallmusic.com/albuminfo.aspx?ID=925 http://www.jimhalljazz.com/hemispheres/ CD 1: ····· * Jim Hall: guitar * Bill Frisell: guitar CD 2: ····· * Jim Hall: guitar * Bill Frisell: guitar * Scott Colley: bass * Joey Baron: drums http://www.jimhallmusic.com/ http://www.scottcolley.com/ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joey_Baron · Disc 1 Recorded on 8 track analog tape at Tony Scherr's house in Brooklyn, NY, during 5 recording sessions from July-December 2007. · Disc 2 Recorded at Sear Sound, NYC, on September 9th, 2008. Reviews ~~~~~~~ By John L Walters http://www.theguardian.com/music/2009/feb/27/jim-hall-bill-frisell-hemispheres Hemispheres, released on the innovative, fan-supported ArtistShare label, is really two albums. One is a set of diverse duets by the master guitarists; the other is a swinging quartet set with bassist Scott Colley and drummer Joey Baron. Hall - who played with Sonny Rollins and Bill Evans, among others, and helped invent folk-jazz on Jimmy Guiffre's The Train and the River - is possibly the most influential jazz guitarist of the pre-Hendrix era. Frisell is the post-rock, post-avant-garde maestro with a penchant for American roots music (as revealed in the Nonesuch compilation reviewed here last week). The quartet tracks, recorded at New York's Sear Sound, are full of surprise and delight, as Hall and Frisell spar good-humouredly on standards such as Sonnymoon for Two and My Funny Valentine. In duo, they can tackle anything: the pulsing soundscape of the 15-minute Migration, a funky Bags Groove, and an eerie take on Dylan's Masters of War. -- By Michael G. Nastos http://www.allmusic.com/album/hemispheres-mw0000804827 By Eyal Hareuveni http://www.allaboutjazz.com/hemispheres-jim-hall-artistshare-review-by-eyal-hareuveni.php By John Kelman http://www.allaboutjazz.com/hemispheres-jim-hall-artistshare-review-by-john-kelman.php By Bill Milkowski http://jazztimes.com/reviews/albums/jim-hall-bill-frisell-hemispheres/ By Don Williamson http://www.jazzreview.com/cd-reviews/various-jazz-styles-cd-reviews/hemispheres-by-jim-hall-bill-frisell.html Par Michel Contat (fr) http://www.telerama.fr/musiques/hemispheres,37635.php
